member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Axis2dAccessor`2.SetAxisSizeFactor(System.Double)
member.summary: Makes the axes take up a larger or smaller portion of the allotted space. The default value is 1. Larger numbers result in axes encompassing a larger region of the screen.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Axis2dAccessor`2.SetAxisSizeFactor(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Makes the axes take up a larger or smaller portion of the allowed space. The default value is (1,1), and this allows you to specify X and Y scales separately.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Axis3dAccessor`3.SetAxisSizeFactor(System.Double)
member.summary: Makes the axes take up a larger or smaller portion of the allotted space. The default value is 1. Larger numbers result in axes encompassing a larger region of the screen.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.VisibleCenter
member.summary: The point in space that is directly in the center of the pixel area spanned by the axes.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.VisibleArea
member.summary: The rectangular area in data coordinates that is visible within the pixel area spanned by the axes.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.GetPixel(ObservatoryLib.Vector2d)
member.summary: The pixel coordinates (possibly off-screen) where a point at the specified location (in data coordinates) will appear. Pixels are (0,0) in the upper-left of the visualization.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.PixelToDataCoords(ObservatoryLib.Vector2d)
member.summary: The data coordinates that are mapped to the specified pixel location. Pixels are (0,0) in the upper-left of the visualization.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.PixelArea
member.summary: The rectangular area, in pixels, that is spanned by the axes of this visualization, and which serves as a basis for many intreractions.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.LookAt(ObservatoryLib.Vector2d,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Translates the camera so that the specified point in data coordinates is in the center of the pixel area spanned by the axes.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.Zoom(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms the camera so that linear dimensions are stretched by the specified factor.
member.param: Inward < 1; Outward > > 1

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.SetMinMax(ObservatoryLib.Vector2d,ObservatoryLib.Vector2d,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the zoom and translation so that the specified min/max values exactly span the pixel area within the axes.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.SetVisibleArea(ObservatoryLib.RectangularArea,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the zoom and translation so that the specified area exactly span the pixel area within the axes.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.SetMinMax(ObservatoryLib.D2,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the zoom and translation along only the specified axis so that the specified values map to the edges of the pixel area within the axes.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.ResetMinMax(ObservatoryLib.RectangularArea,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms and translates to show the specified area in the pixel area within the axes. Further, updates the "reset" area.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.ResetMinMax(System.Nullable{`0},System.Nullable{`0},System.Nullable{`1},System.Nullable{`1},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms and translates to map the specified min/max values to the screen area within the axes. Further, updates the "reset" area. If null is supplied, or if this method is never called, the reset area is determined automatically from the content being visualized.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.ResetMinMaxX(System.Nullable{`0},System.Nullable{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms and translates to map the specified min value to the lower end of the pixel area within the axes, only in the X axis. Further, updates the "reset" area. Zooms and translates the Y axis to map the reset area to the pixel area within that axis. If null is supplied, or if this method is never called, the reset area is determined automatically from the content being visualized.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.ResetMinMaxY(System.Nullable{`1},System.Nullable{`1},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms and translates to map the specified min value to the lower end of the pixel area within the axes, only in the Y axis. Further, updates the "reset" area. Zooms and translates the X axis to map the reset area to the pixel area within that axis. If null is supplied, or if this method is never called, the reset area is determined automatically from the content being visualized.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.ResetMinX(System.Nullable{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms and translates to map the specified min value to the lower end of the pixel area within the axes, only for the X axis. Further, updates the "reset" area. Additionally, zooms and translates the other bounds to map the reset area to the pixel area within the axes. If null is supplied, or if this method is never called, the reset area is determined automatically from the content being visualized.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.ResetMaxX(System.Nullable{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms and translates to map the specified max value to the upper end of the pixel area within the axes, only for the X axis. Further, updates the "reset" area. Additionally, zooms and translates the other bounds to map the reset area to the pixel area within the axes. If null is supplied, or if this method is never called, the reset area is determined automatically from the content being visualized.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.ResetMinY(System.Nullable{`1},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms and translates to map the specified min value to the lower end of the pixel area within the axes, only for the Y axis. Further, updates the "reset" area. Additionally, zooms and translates the other bounds to map the reset area to the pixel area within the axes. If null is supplied, or if this method is never called, the reset area is determined automatically from the content being visualized.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.ResetMaxY(System.Nullable{`1},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms and translates to map the specified max value to the upper end of the pixel area within the axes, only for the Y axis. Further, updates the "reset" area. Additionally, zooms and translates the other bounds to map the reset area to the pixel area within the axes. If null is supplied, or if this method is never called, the reset area is determined automatically from the content being visualized.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.Reset(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms and translates to map the reset area to the pixel area within the axes. If any of the bounds of the reset area were determined automatically, those bounds will be recalculated, and potentially updated if the content being visualized has changed.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.ResetForItem(ObservatoryLib.IPhysicalSyncable{ObservatoryLib.V2{`0,`1}},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the reset area so that it comfortably spans the area that contains the specified item. Additionally, zooms and translates to map the new reset area to the pixel area within the axes.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.ResetForItems(ObservatoryLib.IPhysicalSyncable{ObservatoryLib.V2{`0,`1}}[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the reset area so that it comfortably spans the area that contains all the specified items. Additionally, zooms and translates to map the new reset area to the pixel area within the axes.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera2dAccessor`2.FlipUpsideDown(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the camera so that the current up vector becomes the down vector, and vice versa.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.GetOrientation(ObservatoryLib.Vector3d@,ObservatoryLib.Vector3d@,ObservatoryLib.Vector3d@)
member.summary: Obtains the current rotation of the camera.
member.param: The direction the camera is facing.
The apparent direction of "right" in the camera's image.
The apparent directino of "up" in the camera's image.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.SetOrientation(ObservatoryLib.Vector3d,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rotate the camera so that it faces the specified direction. The roll of the camera will remain unchanged.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.SetOrientation(ObservatoryLib.Vector3d,ObservatoryLib.Vector3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rotate the camera so that it faces in the specified direction and is rolled such that "up" in the image is also in the specified direction.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.GetSubject
member.summary: Gets the location of the "subject" which the camera is looking at. Rotations are rotations about this point.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.SetSubject(ObservatoryLib.Vector3d,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Translates the camera so that the subject is the specified value.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.GetPosition
member.summary: Gets the current position of the camera.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.SetPosition(ObservatoryLib.Vector3d,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the position of the camera in space. Translates the subject of the camera so that its position with respect to the camera is unchanged.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.RotateRelative(System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rotates the camera by the specified angles relative to its current orientation.
member.param: Angle to rotate about the "Up" axis, radians
Angle to rotate about the "Right" axis, radians

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.PanRelativePixels(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Pans the camera left/right and/or up/down by the specified amount in pixels. Positive horizontal means data appears to shift left; Positive vertical means data appears to move down.
member.param: The amount to translate to the right, in pixels.
The amount to translate up, in pixels.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.Zoom(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Causes the camera to zoom inward (if the value is less than 1) or outward (if the value is greater than 1) by the specified scaling factor.
member.param: A factor to zoom in or out. Value of 1 causes no apparent motion either in or out.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.SetProjectionType(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the projection type of the camera to either orthographic or perspective. Does not change the subject or effective field of view.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.GetThetaPhi
member.summary: Gets the current angles that describe which way the camera is facing. Phi ranges from 0 at the +Z axis to pi at the -Z axis. Theta ranges from 0 to 2*pi, starting at the +X axis, and going towards the +Y axis.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.GetIsPerspective
member.summary: Returns true if the camera's current projection mode is perspective; false if it is orthographic.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.SetFieldOfView(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the angular vertical field of view of the camera, in radians. The default is pi/4. If the camera projection mode is orthographic, this method has no effect.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor`3.SetSpatialFieldOfView(System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the spatial field of view of the camera. If the projection mode of the camera is perspective, this method has no effect.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.CameraHelpers.SetOrientation``3(ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor{``0,``1,``2},ObservatoryLib.SignedAxis,ObservatoryLib.SignedAxis,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rotates the camera so that the direction of right and up in its view of the scene are aligned with the specified axes.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.CameraHelpers.SetOrientation``3(ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor{``0,``1,``2},System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rotates the camera so that it faces a direction specified by the specified spherical coordinates. The "roll" of the camera will be unchanged.
member.param: The rotation about the Z-axis by, in radians, towards the +Y axis, from the +X axis (counter-clockwise as viewed from +Z)
The angle, in radians, away from the +Z axis

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.CameraHelpers.LookAt``3(ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor{``0,``1,``2},ObservatoryLib.Vector3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Translates the camera so that the subject is the specified value. (Same as SetSubject).

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.CameraHelpers.ViewXY``3(ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor{``0,``1,``2},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rotate the camera to view the scene with the +X axis pointing to the right, and the +Y axis pointing up.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.CameraHelpers.ViewYZ``3(ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor{``0,``1,``2},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rotate the camera to view the scene with the +Y axis pointing to the right, and the +Z axis pointing up.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.CameraHelpers.ViewXZ``3(ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor{``0,``1,``2},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rotate the camera to view the scene with the +X axis pointing to the right, and the +Z axis pointing up.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.CameraHelpers.FlipUpDown``3(ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor{``0,``1,``2},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rotate the camera such that it faces the opposite direction and up in the image is also opposite.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.CameraHelpers.FlipLeftRight``3(ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor{``0,``1,``2},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rotate the camera such that it faces the opposite direction and up in the image is the same direction as previously.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.CameraHelpers.SetProjectionOrthographic``3(ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor{``0,``1,``2},System.Boolean)
member.summary: View the scene with the same translation and effective field of view, but with an orthographic projection (as if the camera is infinitiely far away).

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.CameraHelpers.SetProjectionPerspective``3(ObservatoryLib.Camera3dAccessor{``0,``1,``2},System.Boolean)
member.summary: View the scene using a perspective projection with the same effective field of view and subject as previously.

member.remarks: If no name is specified when adding elements, they can not be referenced by name in the future. If commit is true, the changes become effective immediately. If commit is false, no changes due to this call will take effect until "Commit" is called, even if there are subsequent other calls made with commit=true.

member.summary: Adds 2 triangles to the drawing, forming the appearance of a quad. NOTE: For performance reasons, use AddTris() or AddQuads() if possible when adding a large number of triangles or quads. The 4 vertices can be ordered either clockwise or counterclockwise.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.IDrawingBuilderExtensions.AddQuads``2(ObservatoryLib.IDrawingBuilder{``0,``1},``0[],``0[],``0[],``0[],ObservatoryLib.Name,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds 2 triangles to the drawing for each quad. The 4 arrays of supplied vertices must be the same length. The number of quads formed will be equal to the length of each of the arrays of vertices. Each quad is formed from the vertices found at the corresponding index of the supplied vertex arrays. Within each quad, order may be either clockwise or counterclockwise.

member.summary: Add a set of triangles by specifying all vertices in a single array. The array of points is ordered such that the first 3 points are the 3 vertices of the first triangles, the next 3 are the 3 vertices of the second triangle, and so on.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.IDrawingBuilderExtensions.AddQuads``2(ObservatoryLib.IDrawingBuilder{``0,``1},``0[],ObservatoryLib.Name,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a set of quads by specifying all vertices in a single array. The array of points is ordered such that the first 4 points are the 4 vertices of the first quad, the next 4 are the 4 vertices of the second quad, and so on. Each set of 4 points can be ordered either clockwise or counterclockwise.

member.param: The colors for the triangles. If the length of this array is equal to the number of vertices, each color corresponds to a single vertex. If the length of this array is 1/3 the number of vertices (i.e. the number of triangles), each color is assumed to correspond to all 3 vertices of the corresponding triangle.

member.summary: Adds a set of quads to the drawing. The i-th element of the X and Y arrays are assumed to correspond to each other. Each array is ordered such that the first 4 points correspond to the 4 vertices of the first quad, the next 4 correspond to the 4 vertices of the second quad, and so on. The 4 vertices for each quad can be ordered either clockwise or counterclockwise.

member.param: The colors for the quads. If the length of this array is equal to the number of vertices, each color corresponds to a single vertex. member.summary: Adds a continuous surface of triangles over a grid of data in X-Y space.
member.param: The x-values of the grid, in ascending order. No repeats.
The y-values of the grid, in ascending order. No repeats.

The z-values at the grid intersection points. Must be (length of x)*(length of y) elements long. Must be in "x-major" order. That is, the first element corresponds to the least (x,y) pair, the second element corresponds to the same y, but the next x, and so on.
The color grid values that correspond to the z-grid values.

member.summary: These methods are all 1:1 with methods in the generic 2D drawing builder extensions. There is no cascading within this class! These methods circumvent the 'shortcoming' in C# wherein I can't implicitly type-convert on an array using an implicit cast. NOTE: Above statement NOT true. Add a set of triangles to the drawing. The i-th element of the X and Y arrays are assumed to correspond to each other. Each array is ordered such that the first 3 points correspond to the 3 vertices of the first triangles, the next 3 are correspond to the 3 vertices of the second triangle, and so on.

Add a set of triangles to the drawing. The i-th element of the X and Y arrays are assumed to correspond to each other. Each array is ordered such that the first 3 points correspond to the 3 vertices of the first triangles, the next 3 are correspond to the 3 vertices of the second triangle, and so on.
member.param: The colors for the triangles. If the length of this array is equal to the number of vertices, each color corresponds to a single vertex. If the length of this array is 1/3 the number of vertices (i.e. the number of triangles), each color is assumed to correspond to all 3 vertices of the corresponding triangle.

member.summary: Adds a set of quads to the drawing. The i-th element of the X and Y arrays are assumed to correspond to each other. Each array is ordered such that the first 4 points correspond to the 4 vertices of the first quad, the next 4 correspond to the 4 vertices of the second quad, and so on. The 4 vertices for each quad can be ordered either clockwise or counterclockwise.

member.name: T:ObservatoryLib.IdGenerator

The int returned by Next() is always the least non-negative int that is not already in use. Intended to minimize the need for shuffling data within a list whose size changes only slightly as many elements are replaced, removed, or re-added.

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.Viz.ColorHelper
member.summary: Enables a convenient mechanism to generate an aesthetic, complementary set of colors to distinguish various items present in this plot.

member.name: P:ObservatoryLib.Viz.Screen
member.summary: Provides a set of methods to conveniently access items placed in the Screen coordinate system.

member.name: P:ObservatoryLib.Viz.Stage
member.summary: A direct reference to the root syncable item that serves as a platform for screen-based items.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Viz.#ctor(ObservatoryLib.IVizSource)
member.summary: A logger that provides extra information about events pertaining to this plot during run-time. For example, warnings messages might be available when the user has done something suspicious or ill-advised.

member.name: E:ObservatoryLib.Viz.NamedItemClicked
member.summary: Fired whenever the user clicks on an item in this plot for which a unique identity (i.e. a Name) has been established.

member.name: E:ObservatoryLib.Viz.FrameComplete
member.summary: Fired each time a new frame has been generated, rendered, and displayed to the screen. Use this, for example, to throttle API commands, or to generate animations.

member.name: E:ObservatoryLib.Viz.NamedItemMouseOver
member.summary: Fired whenever the user mouses over on an item in this plot for which a unique identity (i.e. a Name) has been established.

member.name: E:ObservatoryLib.Viz.BeginFrame
member.summary: Fired when the plot has recognized that a new frame must be generated, either for external or internal reasons. If this event has fired, a new frame will eventually be rendered and displayed.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Viz.Display(ObservatoryLib.Drawing.Rectangle,System.String)
member.summary: Displays this Visualization in a new window by itself.
member.param: The pixel rectangle (origin is in the upper left) on the screen where this Visualization will be displayed.
If true, blocks the calling thread until the new window has been displayed and the first frame has been rendered. If false, control returns to the calling thread immediately.
An optional title for the window.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Viz.ClearAll
member.summary: Removes all [ISyncable] items from the Visualization, except those which are part of the original composition (i.e. those added by Observatory for basic control and interaction).

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Viz.Add(ObservatoryLib.ISyncable)
member.summary: Adds the item to this Visualization. It will be synchronized and rendered in each subsequent frame. Will not take effect until the current frame completes, if a current frame is underway.
member.param: An optional desired name, which serves as a handle to the item for future reference.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Viz.Add(ObservatoryLib.ISyncable[])
member.summary: Adds the items to this Visualization. It will be synchronized and rendered in each subsequent frame. Will not take effect until the current frame completes, if a current frame is underway.
member.param: An optional desired name, which serves as a handle to the item for future reference.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Viz.Remove(ObservatoryLib.ISyncable)
member.summary: Removes an item from the Visualization, if it is present.
member.param: The item to remove.
member.returns: True if the item was present; False otherwise.

member.summary: Save a screen shot of the visualization to file.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Viz.ObtainScreenShot(System.Action{ObservatoryLib.Drawing.Bitmap})
member.summary: Requests a full-frame screen-shot, and calls a delegate when the screenshot is available. Does not block.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Viz.DoEachFrame(System.Action{System.Int32},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a specified action once per frame, and queues the generation of the next frame.
member.param: The action to be called once per frame. Input is a sequential integer.
A maximum number of frames which, when reached, prevents the action from being called anymore.
DO NOT USE.
A maximum duration after which the action will not be called anymore.
member.returns: A delegate which, when invoked, cancels this action.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.CornerRounding.DistanceFromCorner(System.Double)
member.summary: Imagine 2 segments in 2D that share a common point. Imagine moving a circle towards that point of intersection until it comes it contact with both segment an equal distance along each from the intersection point. For a circle with radius 1, this is the distance between the intersection of the segments and either of the intersections with the circle.
member.param: The inner angle between the two segments.

member.name: T:ObservatoryLib.PickId
member.summary: A very small class, defined by an int ID which is globally unique. A one-to-one mapping from ID to System.Drawing.Color is used to uniquely identify a given object during click-pick rendering. All rendered objects have a Pick Index. Multiple objects can share the same Pick Index. This class guarantees that each Pick Index maps to only one user-specified Guid, called a Pick Name. As "names" are used and un-unsed, the int Indices are recycled using an IdGenerator, to prevent integer overflow. Overflow is still possible, of course, if the sheer number of uniquely identifiable items is too large. An exception is thrown if the limit is reached.

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.PickIdMapping.IndexNameMap
member.summary: The authoritative mapping between Pick Index and Pick Name

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.PickIdMapping._Generator
member.summary: Generates sequential Click Ids on-demand and supports re-use of unused Ids

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.PickIdMapping.GetOrCreateIndex(ObservatoryLib.Name)
member.summary: Obtain the Click Id that maps 1-to-1 with this name. If the mapping has not yet been determined, a new Click Id will be generated.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.PickIdMapping.TryGetName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to get the Pick Name for the specified Pick Index. Note however that the mapping may not exist yet, and if so, an exception will be thrown. All Pick Indices are generated on-demand from a specified Pick Name. If the Index was validly obtained, there *should* be a corresponding Name, created at a previous time.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.PickIdMapping.UnUse(ObservatoryLib.Name)
member.summary: Signify that the specified Click Name is no longer in use, such that its Click Id can be re-used and associated to another Click Name if requested in the future. It is harmless to call this method with the special Click Names.

member.summary: Identifies the syncable that directly owns the keyed pick Id.

member.name: T:ObservatoryLib.Slot
member.summary: Describes a finite, continuous block within an array.

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.IrregularSingleBuffer._Buffer
member.summary: The actual buffer contining all the serialized data in its final form:

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.IrregularSingleBuffer._ReserveStart
member.summary: The index in the buffer where the "reserve" portion begins. The "reserve" portion occupies the last ~10% or so of the buffer. Reserve gets used up like telomeres, and in this sense, irregular buffer re-use is art mimicking life.

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.IrregularSingleBuffer._Items
member.summary: A mapping from each item in the buffer to the slot that it occupies. Does not represent pending items.

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.IrregularSingleBuffer._Free
member.summary: Indicates all the slots which have been vacated and are available for re-use by another item. Key represents the size of the slot, and the values represents all slots avaialable for re-use of a given size.

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.IrregularSingleBuffer._PendingRemovals
member.summary: Items which will be removed the next time this is serialized. Note: this may include duplicates; nothing bad will happen.

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.IrregularSingleBuffer._PendingAdditions
member.summary: Items that will be added the next time this is serialized. All items must have an identifier (Name) in addition to their payload.

member.name: T:ObservatoryLib.IReusableBuffer
member.summary: An object that maintains a set of key-value pairs (Name to float array) and will return a complete serialized array on command. Serialization is not guaranteed in any particular order, but it is always the same when the other methods are called in the same order. You can query to find the ordinal position of a specified object in the array, however.

member.name: T:ObservatoryLib.RegularReusableBuffer
member.summary: Maintains a set of key-value pairs (Name to float array) and can serialize them into a single buffer on command. Requires that all input float array values are of the same length. Uses this constraint to minimize the amount of shuffling and re-allocating necessary. Ordering in the buffer is determined by the order of the calls to the public methods, and independent of anything else. This property enables multiple to be used in a set in a context that is sensitive to the relative sequencing of the sets, but not the absolute sequencing.

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.RegularReusableBuffer._IdGenerator
member.summary: Determines the order in which items will appear in the array buffers. It will re-use space when items are no longer in use.

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.RegularReusableBuffer._Indices
member.summary: A mapping of which item was placed in which ordinal position within the buffers. Needed in order to render a subset of the available items.

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.RegularReusableBuffer._Items
member.summary: A mapping from Id to the item with that Id.

member.name: F:ObservatoryLib.RegularReusableBuffer._BuffersNeedSerialization
member.summary: Whether or not the buffers need to be serialized based on a change to their source content.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.RegularReusableBuffer.#ctor(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Construct for a set of items to be added which must all have float arrays of the length specified.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.RegularReusableBuffer.AddOrUpdateItem(ObservatoryLib.Name,System.Boolean[],System.Single[][])
member.summary: Add an item to the buffer. If the item exists already, it will be replaced. If not, it will be added. Calling this method is always fast and does not involve array copying or shuffling.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.RegularReusableBuffer.ReleaseItem(ObservatoryLib.Name)
member.summary: Removes the item from the set so that the space can be re-used. If you intend to re-add the same item again, you should call SetIsVisible instead TODO! DOES NOT EXIST YET

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.RegularReusableBuffer.Clear

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.RegularReusableBuffer.SerializeBuffers(System.Int32@)

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.PrimitiveScreenShaderSource.VertexBody
member.summary: The camera is at the origin, facing the -Z direction. Field of view magnitude is equal to 1 in each axis. Centered on (0,0) with lowest values corresponding to the LOWER left. This is in the OpenGL spec. This shader normalizes and shifts according to the viewport size. Simple pass-through of color to fragment shader.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.PrimitiveScreenShaderSource.FragmentBody

member.name: T:ObservatoryLib.Surface
member.summary: A drawing to represent a set of numeric values which have been sampled throughout a uniform 2D grid. Can be drawn as a grid of vertices, a mesh, or a solid surface.

member.name: E:ObservatoryLib.Surface.VertexClicked
member.summary: Fired when the user clicks on a point in this drawing. The argument is the identity of the point that was clicked on. Note: To enable this event, you must first call EnablePickIdentifications(true).

member.name: E:ObservatoryLib.Surface.GridLineClicked
member.summary: Fired when the user clicks on the mesh in this drawing. The arguments are the identities of the vertices on either end of the line segment which was clicked on. Note: To enable this event, you must first call EnablePickIdentifications(true).

member.name: E:ObservatoryLib.Surface.SurfaceClicked
member.summary: Fired when the user clicks on the solid surface of this drawing. The arguments supplied are the vertices of the triangle that was clicked on. Note: To enable this event, you must first call EnablePickIdentifications(true).

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Surface.FromUnorderedVertices(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new Surface drawing, which represents values sampled on a 2D grid as points, a mesh, and/or a solid surface. This method expects the input X, Y, and Z values to be of the same length, and that they correspond one-to-one with each other. It further assumes that the X and Y values of the source data form a grid, and that every point in the grid has exactly one corresponding element (x, y, and z) in the supplied input vectors. An exception is thrown if these conditions are not met.
member.param: All X values, including repeats.
All Y values, including repeats.
All Z values. The ith Z-value is the dependent variable that corresponds to the grid point location defined by the ith X and Y values.
Optional values to supply for the colors at each X,Y pair combination. If not null, must be the same length as Z. If null, the Z values themselves are used as the default.
Whether this drawing should show points at each of the grid vertices.
Whether this drawing should show a mesh of lines connecting adjacent grid vertices.
Whether this drawing should show a solid surface of triangles interpolating the space between adjacent vertices.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Surface.FromVertices(ObservatoryLib.Vector3d[],System.Double[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new Surface drawing, which represents values sampled on a 2D grid as points, a mesh, and/or a solid surface. This method assumes that the X and Y values of the source data form a grid, and that every point in the grid has exactly one corresponding vector in the source data. An exception is thrown if these conditions are not met.
member.param: All x,y,z vertices of the source data, in any order.
Optional values to supply for the colors at each X,Y pair combination. If not null, must be the same length as Z. If null, the Z values themselves are used as the default.
Whether this drawing should show points at each of the grid vertices.
Whether this drawing should show a mesh of lines connecting adjacent grid vertices.
Whether this drawing should show a solid surface of triangles interpolating the space between adjacent vertices.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.Surface.#ctor(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new Surface drawing, which represents values sampled on a 2D grid as points, a mesh, and/or a solid surface.
member.param: The unique X values of the sampled grid, in increasing order. No duplicates allowed.
The unique Y values of the sampled grid, in increasing order. No duplicates allowed.

The Z values which correspond to each of the X,Y pair combinations. The length must be equal to the product of the lengths of the unique X and Y inputs. The values are to be supplied in "x-major" orderFor example, the 2nd value corresponds to the 2nd X and the first Y value.
Optional values to supply for the colors at each X,Y pair combination. If not null, must be the same length as Z. If null, the Z values themselves are used as the default.
Whether this drawing should show points at each of the grid vertices.
Whether this drawing should show a mesh of lines connecting adjacent grid vertices.
Whether this drawing should show a solid surface of triangles interpolating the space between adjacent vertices.

There is a performance benefit to reusing IDs for the "same" items from one frame to the next, because these items are usually of the same type and length of serialized buffers. Buffer allocation is intelligent, especially for items of fixed buffer size.

member.name: T:ObservatoryLib.ISyncable
member.summary: The minimum set of functionality that must be provided for any item to live within the Observatory plot synchronization life-cycle.

member.name: P:ObservatoryLib.ISyncable.SyncableOwnerId
member.summary: A single immutable identifier for this syncable. Used to identify which syncable item "owns" each serialized item, so that they can all be removed when this item is removed from the synchronizer.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.ISyncable.Synchronize
member.summary: Called to signify that it is time to update the item's internal state, so that it is update-to-date with events that have occurred, and internally consistent, even if such operations are expensive. The state variables managed by the plot sync will not change between this time, and the next time a frame is drawn. If nothing has necessitated any changes since the last frame, no action may be required.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.ISyncable.Serialize
member.summary: Called after Synchronize() and before rendering. There will be no more sync actions that affect any syncable between now and when the next frame is rendered.

member.name: E:ObservatoryLib.ISyncable.BecameOutOfSync
member.summary: Fired to signify that the item is aware that it is no longer up-to-date, and a call to Synchronize() is necessitated before it can be put in a consistent state.

member.name: P:ObservatoryLib.ISyncable.IsOutOfSync

member.name: P:ObservatoryLib.PlotSyncBase.Baton

member.name: P:ObservatoryLib.PlotSyncBase.DisplayQueue
member.summary: Before the visualization is displayed, enables actions to be queued for completion at display-time. During display, enables actions to be queued for completion between frames, and will block until those actions are complete. Work can be queued from any thread. Obviates much of the need for external parties to interact with the frame-synchronization cycle.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.ScreenShotSaver.ObtainScreenShot(System.Boolean,System.Action{ObservatoryLib.Drawing.Bitmap})
member.summary: Note that if you are calling this from a "UI" thread (e.g. internal to Observatory), you have to use wait=false, otherwise it will hang forever...

member.name: T:ObservatoryLib.SyncDisplayQueue
member.summary: Enables sync-time actions to be queued with appropriate blocking behavior whether they are queued before or after the plot has been displayed.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.SyncDisplayQueue.QueueAndWait(System.Action{ObservatoryLib.IResetWaiter})
member.summary:
Queues the action to run after the current frame finishes synchronization, and before the next one. If the underlying plot-sync has not yet rendered the first frame: - The action is queued to run after the completion of the first frame. - The calling thread will NOT block, however, the subsequent call to Display() *will* block until your action is complete.
If the plot-sync *has* rendered at least one frame: - An IResetWaiter is supplied to your action, and this method will block until it has been Set() by your method.
IMPORTANT: This cannot be called from the Sync() method after the first frame has rendered. It will block on the same thread that ultimately needs to take action to unblock it.

member.name: P:ObservatoryLib.InteractionManager.PickNames
member.summary: A list of all IDs that this syncable item (but not its children, if there are any) would respond to if clicked on. If there are extra items in this set, it will only be a problem if the same item is present in another syncable. If an item is created by this syncable, and the item is NOT present in this list, nothing will happen when the item is clicked on (or otherwise identified).

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.VantageController3d.PreserveRelativeScale(ObservatoryLib.RectangularSolid)
member.summary: Adjusts a proposed new volume in data coordinates so that it will preserve the current enforced axis scale equality. If different coordinates have different zoom changes, it will ensure that the final zoom on the enforced axes will be that of the one which is scaling down the most in size (or scaling up the least).
member.param: The volume in data coordinates that is being proposed as the new subject volume.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.VantageController3d.PreserveRelativeScale(ObservatoryLib.RectangularSolid,ObservatoryLib.D3)
member.summary: Adjusts a proposed new volume in data coordinates so that it will preserve the current enforced axis scale equality. If different coordinates have different zoom changes, it will ensure that they all have the same zoom as the one in the specified coordinate, assuming that the specified coordinate is included in the set of axes being held to scale equality.
member.param: The volume in data coordinates that is being proposed as the new subject volume.
The coordinate whose zoom is to be enforced across other axes where enforced by scale equality.

member.name: M:ObservatoryLib.VantageController3d.PreserveRelativeScale(ObservatoryLib.RectangularSolid,System.Double)
member.summary: Adjusts a proposed volume specified in data coordinates so that it will preserve the current enforced axis scale equality. If different coordinates have different zoom changes, it will ensure that they all have the specified *change* in zoom.
member.param: The volume in data coordinates that is being proposed as the new subject volume.
The desired scale *change* to produce on scale-equal axes.

members.member:
Tweens the camera to view from orthographic or perspective projection. All subsequent zooms are handled according to the new camera model of zooming. The "initial" state must also be reset to something equivalent.
